p: Although several WNV surveys have been performed on birds, as far as we know, there are no studies concerning wild mammals in Italy. Hunter-harvested mammals, such as European wild boar, often are more accessible than wild birds and allow the collection of more abundant blood samples. Thus it has often been proposed to use mammals as alternative Flavivirus sentinels because contact detection would show exposure outside the enzootic bird cycle [ 14, 15].
